v.v: Then Job replied,
“Yes, yes, I know.
If someone wanted to argue with God about that,
God is very wise and powerful;
He even moves mountains in earthquakes without telling anyone in advance.
He sends earthquakes that shake the ground;
Some days he speaks to the sun, and it does not rise,
He alone stretched [stretches] out the sky;
He set in their places the groups of stars— the Bear, Orion, the Pleiades, and the groups of stars in the southern sky.
He does great things that we cannot understand;
He passes by where I am, but I cannot see him;
If he wants to snatch someone away, no one could stop him;
God will not very easily stop being angry;
If God took me to court,
Even though I would be innocent, I would not be able to answer him.
If I summoned him to come to the courtroom and he said that he would come,
He sends storms to batter me,
It is as though he will not let me get my breath
If I tried to wrestle with him, there would be no way to defeat him,
Even though I was innocent, anything I said would cause him to punish me;
I have not done anything wrong, but that is not important anymore because I do not care what happens to me.
Nothing is important to me
When people experience disaster and it causes them to suddenly die,
God has allowed wicked people to control what happens in the world.
My days pass very quickly, like a fast runner who passes one by;
My life goes by very rapidly, like a swiftly sailing boat made from reeds
If I smile and say to God, ‘I will forget what I am complaining about;
then I become afraid because of all that I am suffering
He will condemn me anyway,
If I washed myself with snow
he would still throw me into a filthy pit;
God is not a human, as I am,
There is no one to mediate,
I wish someone else could stop God from making me suffer,
If he did that, I would declare that I am innocent without being afraid of him
I detest living any longer.
I will say to God, ‘Do not just say that you must punish me;
Does it please you to oppress me,
Do you understand things the way that we humans do?
Do you live for only a few years, like [as] we do?
So why do you continue to search for my faults
You know that I am not guilty,
With your hands you created me and shaped my body,
Do not forget that you made me from a piece of clay;
You certainly formed me when I was conceived,
You fastened my bones together with sinews,
You have caused me to be alive; you have faithfully loved me,
But you kept secret what you were planning to do to me;
You were watching to see if I would sin,
If I am a wicked man, I hope that terrible things will happen to me.
And if I am proud, you hunt me like a lion hunts for some animal to kill,
You constantly find more witnesses to testify that I have done what is wrong,
God, why did you allow me to be born?
I think it would have been better if I had been carried directly from my mother’s womb to the grave
I think that there are only a few days for me to remain alive;
before I go to the place from which I will never return,
a place of darkness and dark shadows where everything is confused

v: But how can anyone say to God, ‘I am innocent’?
God could ask him a thousand questions
and that person would not be able to answer any of them!
no one who has tried to argue against him has ever been able to win.
When he is angry, he turns the mountains upside down.
he causes the columns that support the earth to shake.
and some nights he prevents the stars from shining.
he alone puts his feet on the waves and stops their violence.
he does more marvelous things than we are able to count.
he moves further on, but I do not see him go.
no one dares ask him, ‘Why are you doing that?’
he defeated the servants of Rahab, the great sea monster.
what could I say to answer him?
All I could do would be to request God, my judge, to act mercifully toward me.
I would not believe that he would pay attention to what I would say.
and he bruises me many times without any reason.
because he causes me to suffer all the time.
because he is stronger than I am.
If I called him to appear in court,
there is no one who could force him to go there.
even though I had not done anything wrong, he would still prove that I was guilty.
I despise living.
because God will get rid of all of us, both those who are innocent and those who are wicked.
God laughs at it, even if they are innocent.
It is as though he had caused judges to be blind, no longer able to judge fairly.
If it is not God who has done that,
who, then, has done it?
it is as though the days run away, and nothing good ever happens to me.
or like an eagle that swoops down to seize an animal.
I will stop looking sad and try to be cheerful,’
because I know that God does not consider that I am innocent.
so why should I keep trying in vain to defend myself?
or cleansed my hands with lye
to get rid of my guilt,
as a result it would be as though even my clothes would detest me.
so there is no way that I could answer him to prove that I am innocent
if we went together to have a trial in a courtroom.
no one who has authority over both of us.
and that he would not continue to terrify me.
because I know within myself that I really have not done what is wrong like God thinks that I have.
